titleStmt.title: Englands petition to King Charles. Or, An humble petition of the distressed and almost destroyed subjects of England, to the Kings most excellent Majestie, now at the Isle of Wight, that ye would yeeld to His Parliament in all their reasonable demands in the treatie there. Containing the very sense of all the loyall-hearted true lovers of the King.
Englands petition to their King.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed in the month that the Scots Army were utterly overthrown, and Colchester taken,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
